name: Letters of Marque
description: Official documents granting legal authority to perform specific activities that would otherwise be illegal.

letters.name: Privateer Commission
letters.description: A letter authorizing the bearer to attack and capture enemy ships on behalf of a sovereign nation.
letters.authority: Attack and seize enemy merchant and military vessels
mechanicalEffects: Legal immunity for piracy charges in the issuing nation
Right to keep 50% of captured cargo (remainder goes to the crown)
Access to friendly ports for repairs and resupply
Advantage on Charisma checks when dealing with naval authorities of the issuing nation
restrictions: Must not attack vessels of allied nations
Must pay the crown's share of captured goods
Can be revoked for attacking friendly ships

letters.name: Bounty Hunter's License
letters.description: Authorization to pursue, capture, and return fugitives for a reward.
letters.authority: Pursue and apprehend named criminals across jurisdictions
mechanicalEffects: Legal authority to detain wanted individuals
Access to criminal records and bounty postings
Advantage on Charisma (Intimidation) checks against wanted criminals
restrictions: Must bring targets back alive unless specified otherwise
Must not cause excessive collateral damage
Jurisdiction limited to the issuing region unless otherwise stated

letters.name: Writ of Exploration
letters.description: A document granting the bearer authority to explore, map, and claim territory in the name of a sovereign.
letters.authority: Explore uncharted lands and claim them for the issuing authority
mechanicalEffects: Legal right to any treasures found in unclaimed territory
Access to royal cartographers and supplies
Advantage on Charisma checks when requesting aid from the issuing nation's outposts
restrictions: Must report discoveries to the issuing authority
Must not provoke conflict with established civilizations

letters.name: Inquisitorial Warrant
letters.description: Authority to investigate, interrogate, and judge matters related to a specific threat (e.g., cults, undead, fiends).
mechanicalEffects: Authority to enter private property in pursuit of the threat
Legal authority to detain and question suspects
Cooperation from clergy and local authorities
Advantage on Charisma (Intimidation) checks during interrogations related to the warrant's scope
restrictions: Authority limited to the specified threat
Must report findings to the issuing authority
Abuse of power results in revocation and possible prosecution
